ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: 3D building map generation
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ 3D building mapping â€¢ GLB export â€¢ OpenStreetMap data integration
ðŸ“– Summary: This repository provides a 3D building mapping service using React-Three-Fiber and OpenStreetMap data. It allows exporting maps as GLB files and has potential applications in digital twin creation, drone surveying, and GPS marker integration. The accuracy of the data depends on OpenStreetMap, and future improvements include manual data correction and enhanced customization options.

ðŸ’¡ Maestro | Kotlin
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: UI testing framework for mobile and web applications
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Built-in tolerance to flakiness in UI elements and screen taps â€¢ Built-in tolerance to delays without needing `sleep()` calls â€¢ Blazingly fast iteration with interpreted tests and continuous monitoring â€¢ Declarative YAML syntax for test definition â€¢ Single binary for cross-platform compatibility
ðŸ“– Summary: Maestro is a UI testing framework designed for mobile and web applications. It addresses common testing challenges like flakiness and delays with built-in tolerance mechanisms and uses a declarative YAML syntax for efficient test definition. Its single binary architecture ensures easy setup and cross-platform compatibility.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ nfcgate | Java
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Security research: reverse engineering and security assessment of NFC protocols
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ On-device NFC traffic capture â€¢ NFC traffic relay between two devices using a server â€¢ Replay of captured NFC traffic â€¢ Cloning of initial tag information â€¢ Export of captured traffic in pcapng format readable by Wireshark
ðŸ“– Summary: NFCGate is an Android application for capturing, analyzing, and modifying NFC traffic. It supports various modes including relay, replay, and cloning, and allows exporting data in the pcapng format for further analysis with tools like Wireshark. This application is intended for security research purposes.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ faiss | C++
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Similarity search and clustering of dense vectors
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Efficient similarity search and clustering of dense vectors â€¢ Handles vectors of any size, including those that don't fit in RAM â€¢ Algorithms implemented on GPU for faster processing â€¢ Supports L2 distance, dot products, and cosine similarity
ðŸ“– Summary: Faiss is a library for efficient similarity search and clustering of dense vectors. It supports various algorithms, including GPU-accelerated options, and offers a range of indexing structures to optimize for different performance needs. It's designed to handle datasets of any size and provides interfaces in both C++ and Python.

ðŸš€ pensieve | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Privacy-focused screen recording and retrieval system
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Passive screen recording â€¢ Local data storage â€¢ Full-text and vector search â€¢ Ollama integration â€¢ OpenAI API compatibility
ðŸ“– Summary: Pensieve is a privacy-focused application that records screen activity, indexes it for searching, and provides a web interface for access. It uses local storage to maintain user data privacy and integrates with Ollama and OpenAI APIs for enhanced functionality. Supports full-text and vector search for efficient retrieval of recorded content.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ chatbox | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Provides a desktop and mobile client for interacting with large language models like ChatGPT and Claude.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Desktop client for ChatGPT, Claude and other LLMs â€¢ Available on Windows, Mac, Linux â€¢ iOS and Android apps available
ðŸ“– Summary: Chatbox is a desktop and mobile application that allows users to interact with various large language models. It offers versions for Windows, macOS, and Linux desktops, as well as iOS and Android mobile platforms. The application aims to provide a user-friendly interface for accessing the capabilities of LLMs.

âœ¨ afrog | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: A security tool for vulnerability research and exploitation
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Bug Bounty â€¢ Pentest â€¢ Red Teaming
ðŸ“– Summary: Afrog is a security tool designed for bug bounty hunting, penetration testing, and red teaming activities. It helps in identifying and exploiting vulnerabilities. The tool is actively developed and maintained, with contributions from multiple developers.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ SDL | C
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Development of multimedia software, such as games and emulators
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Cross-platform compatibility â€¢ Ease of use for multimedia software development â€¢ Support for game and emulator development
ðŸ“– Summary: The Simple DirectMedia Layer (SDL) is a cross-platform library designed to simplify the creation of multimedia applications, including games and emulators. It offers ease of use and broad compatibility across different operating systems. SDL's primary purpose is to provide a streamlined interface for handling various multimedia tasks.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ docuseal | Ruby
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Open source document filling and signing
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ PDF form fields builder (WYSIWYG) â€¢ 12 field types available (Signature, Date, File, Checkbox etc.) â€¢ Multiple submitters per document â€¢ Automated emails via SMTP â€¢ Files storage on disk or AWS S3, Google Storage, Azure Cloud
ðŸ“– Summary: DocuSeal is an open-source platform for secure digital document signing and processing. It allows users to create and manage fillable PDF forms with various field types, supports multiple submitters, and offers integrations via API and webhooks. Deployment is simplified through Docker and various cloud platforms.
